name: places/ChIJIQ3YijBZwokRUTehB6GJQU4
formattedAddress: 99 Charles St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 99 Charles St, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text: I wish I could give a negative star. I arrived right before 10:30AM yesterday as I had an appointment and lunch in the neighborhood. The attendant asked me how long I would be. I said I would be gone by 3PM. He said that is the 10 hour rate at $53 but if I pay in cash it would be $50. I said I would pay in cash. I asked if I could pre-pay and he said you pay when you pick up car. I arrived slightly before 3PM (well within the 10 hours I had Paid for) I gave him my ticket with a $100 bill. He returned $32. I said this is not correct. You told me iit would be $50 cash, He charged me $68. WHATTTTTT? I said you owe me $18. He said to quote"You told me you were only staying 2 hours". EVen if I said that it would be less than the $50 for the 10 hours. I wanted to call the police but I had to leave for another appointment that I could not miss. DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS POS LYING PLACE. THIS IS A VERY BAD MAN WHO RUNS THIS PLACE. Not for nothing...I grew up in NYC and lived there most of my adult life. I know the drill. This is rip-off on steroids. Run for the hills. I hope whoever owns this lot reads what is going on in his facility unless, of course, the fish rots from the head and he or she is part of this scam. I have informed the local police preceint of this scam.

originalText.text:
Absolute horrible costumer service from this location. I really hope had my original pick been open they would've been nicer.
After waiting around for 45 minutes I was told I couldn't rent because my card was coming up as a debit and not a visa. They had suggested a different rental company for and stated that they would "lose their job if they tried to rent to me" after an hour of waiting around a manager was called and they left the room to speak with him, came back in and said the manager would be here in 10 mins if I wanted to wait. (I've already been here an hour what's 10 more mins)
Then proceed to ask me to step outside for a minute.. then started yelling to the manager on the phone, slammed doors and yelled some more.
They would not take my Visa debit as a credit card and said it would be a $500 security deposit for a debit card along with a passport. I had used the last of my spendable cash to cab it to the other location that didn't get reimbursed, so I could do the 2 hour commute back to my room to get my passport. Especially when I should've been on the road 2 hours prior. Not worth the time or effort I spent here.
